head.supplied: 22/6/93. ¶ J. Archibald Esqr &c ¶ Curator of the Warrnambool public Museum ¶ Honored Sir. ¶ ¶ In reply to your letter, just received, I beg to inform you, 1, that the edition of the "fragmenta" was a...

div.p: Ralph E. Pattison Reference Library, Warrnambool City Library, Victoria.

Trans. 23.5.94. To proof.
Name in full. MS is glued inside a copy of B87.13.04 and B88.13.01 bound together. 22/6/93.
Curator of the Warrnambool public Museum

In reply to your letter, just received, I beg to inform you, 1, that the edition of the "fragmenta" was a small one, and thus the volumes, which appeared from 1858 to 1866 are no longer obtainable at the Gov Printing Office, but may occasionally be purchased at bookstalls. 2, Your Library has nearly all my works secured; but a new one is commenced "Iconography of Candolleaceaus plants", the first decade of which can be got at the Gov. Printing Office. 3, In your Library remain wanting the volume of letterpress to "the plants indigenous to the colony Victoria", "Descriptive notes on Papuan plants 1-9", "Australian Mosses" "Systematic Census of Australian Plants" the first and second of these at the Gov Printing Office the Second Census can still be secured, the others might be got at some occasion auction. 4, The Mines-Department could supply the two Decades "Vegetable Fossils of the auriferous drifts". 5, I shall feel honored to supply a lithographic portrait, but none is left at present, so that a new set will have to be printed off.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: With Mr Bentham I published the seven volumes of the "Flora Australiensis" but they must be ordered from London

Have you the latest (enlarged) edition of the "Select plants"
B93.13.10. published 1891 at the Governt Printing Office?
